results.title: Neville Mendham: agronomist
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The territory of Papua New Guinea offers many opportunities for technicians in all branches of science. In this film, the first of a series to be made about this general subject, the man studied is a agronomist working in a developing society and a land of great promise, on a project to develop an oil palm industry.

results.title: Never Too Old
results.brief_description: Never too old is about relationships for the over 60s. Through the use of observational documentary we are introduced to several people who have lost their partners and find that sexual and emotional needs do not necessarily diminish with age. Dave and Betty are the centrepiece of this film. Each had been happily married for more than 35 years, and they are now embarking on a new relationship.

results.title: Never too late
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An examination of the opportunities for further education, training and employment for mature-age Aboriginal women. The first part of the program focuses on four women in the Northern Territory, three of whom work as rangers in Kakadu National Park. The program then turns to Sydney to the Murawina Multi-Purpose Aboriginal Education Centre, entirely owned and conducted by Aboriginal women, and dedicated to fostering the further education of Aboriginal women and girls by providing full hostel accommodation and childcare for its students.

results.brief_description: Excerpts from an outdoor concert given by the Little River Band. The members give us an insight into their backgrounds, their hopes and aspirations.

results.title: Never a dull moment
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, Anne Wheeler and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Peter Jamieson, Edmonton’s self-appointed “town crier”, is an unlikely court jester to a western boom town. From early morning until evening, six days a week, an aging Jamieson marches through downtown streets proclaiming the latest news, weather and sports, just as he has done for more than forty years.

results.title: Neurotica: middle-age spread and other life crises
results.brief_description: Compilation of Canadian animated shorts that address serious issues such as urban isolation, loneliness and various neuroses, mostly in a blackly comic manner. “Bob’s birthday” (Prod, dir, Alison Snowden, David Fine) A forty-year-old dentist faces a mid-life crisis. “No problem” (Prod, Eunice Macaulay, Marcy Page, dir, Craig Welch) An aging bachelor seeks to improve his lot in life. “Rosemary and George” (Prod, Eunice Macaulay, dirs, Alison Snowden, David Fine) A man set in his solitary ways, procrastinates about asking his neighbour out on a date. “Strings” (Prod, David Verrall, dir, Wendy Tilby) A leaky faucet briefly brings two city apartment dwellers together. “The Big snit” (Prods, Richard Condie, Michael Scott, dir, Richard Condie) One day in the life of a squabbling, Scrabble-playing couple unaware that a nuclear war is going on just outside their house. “Shyness” (Prods, Bill Pettigrew, David Verrall, dir, Les Drew) Dr Frankenstein creates a neurotically shy monster. “Getting started” (Prods, Michael Scott, Jerry Krepakevich, dir, Richard Condie) Procrastination is taken to new heights in this absurd tale of a man avoiding piano practice. “Special delivery” (Pro, Derek Lamb, dirs, John Weldon, Eunice Macaulay) Ralph’s failure to shovel the front stairs leads to a dead mailman and a vanishing wife. “Get a job” (Prods, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott, Brad Caslor, dir, Brad Caslor) In this 50s inspired musical, an unemployed dog faces the perils of the job hunt. “Why me?” (Prods, dirs Janet Perlman, Derek Lamb) A man who has five minutes to live, races through a gamut of emotions. “Scant sanity” (Prod, David Verrall, dir, John F. Weldon) A man teetering on the edge of reality experiences a slew of imaginary scenarios whilst suffering through a terrifying job interview.

results.title: Neurological examination of the full term neonate
results.brief_description: Intended primarily for doctors, shows in detail the system of examination devised by Dr. Neil O’Doherty to evaluate the responses of full-term newly born babies to seventeen groups of tests of their tactile, motor, auditory and visual behaviours.

results.title: Netscape Navigator 2 GIF
results.brief_description: Netscape Navigator 2 was a proprietary web browser released by Netscape Communications Corporation as its flagship product.

constellations_other.name: Magic lanterns and internet culture
constellations_other.description: The basic animation techniques of magic lanterns are strangely similar to internet aesthetics.

results.description:
Netscape Navigator 2 was a proprietary web browser released by Netscape Communications Corporation as its flagship product. Versions were available for Microsoft Windows, Apple Macintosh, Linux, IRIX, HP-UX, AIX, Solaris, SunOS, and FreeBSD.

The browser introduced and improved a number of features and also added proprietary extensions to the HTML standard. Notably, Netscape 2 was the first browser to support JavaScript and animated gifs, two technologies still predominant on the web today.
description_for_label:
Netscape Navigator 2 was a proprietary web browser released by Netscape Communications Corporation as its flagship product. Versions were available for Microsoft Windows, Apple Macintosh, Linux, IRIX, HP-UX, AIX, Solaris, SunOS, and FreeBSD.

The browser introduced and improved a number of features and also added proprietary extensions to the HTML standard. Notably, Netscape 2 was the first browser to support JavaScript and animated gifs, two technologies still predominant on the web today.

results.title: Netball: the Australian way
results.creator_credit: All Australian Netball Association and Production Group
results.brief_description: This film provides a comprehensive guide to netball and is directed at teachers, student teachers and coaches giving practical advice on skills and training. The need for a coach to have a caring attitude towards the player is stressed throughout. Topics include: the game; successful coaching; coaching and learning skills; basic skills; skills practices; tactics; strategies and matchplay and planning a training program.
